Name: infimum
Description: Greatest lower bound on a set

Name: supremum
Description: Lowest upper bound on a set

Name: completeness of R
Description: All sets have an inf and sup

Name: density of rationals
Description: There is a rational number between every 2 real numbers

Name: epsilon delta limits
Description: for all \epsilon>0 there exists \delta>0 such that |x-x_0|<\delta implies |f(x)-c|<\epsilon

Name: sequence limits
Description: for all \epsilon>0 there exists N such that n>N implies |a_n - c| < \epsilon

Name: limit laws
Description: Various laws that help do limits

Name: Bolzano-Weierstrass
Description: All bounded sequences have a convergent subsequence

Name: Cauchy criterion for sequence convergence
Description: for all \epsilon>0 there exists N such that n,m>N implies |a_n - a_m|<\epsilon

Name: squeeze test
Description: squeeze sequence between two other sequences

Name: comparison test
Description: sum is infinite/finite if greater/less than another sequence

Name: basic divergence test
Description: if a_n to infty then series diverges

Name: Cauchy's condensation test
Description: sum of 2^n a_{2^n} has the same convergence/divergence

Name: Dirichlet's test
Description: a_n to zero and sum of b_n bounded. then sum a_nb_n = 0

Name: Open sets
Description: every number has an epsilon ball contained in the set

Name: Closed sets
Description: every limit point is in the set

Name: Limit point
Description: for every delta>0 there is another point in the set nearby

Name: compactness (sets): covering definition
Description: every open covering has a finite subcovering

Name: sequential compactness (sets)
Description: all sequences converge inside the set

Name: Heine-Borel theorem
Description: compact sets in R iff closed and bounded

Name: uniform continuity
Description: for a given epsilon, one delta applies for all of the function

Name: rolles theorem
Description: f(a)=f(b) there is a point where f'(c) = 0

Name: Variation of Parameters
Description: A long and tedious diffeq method

Name: Laplace Transform
Description: an integral transform that converts a function of a real variable (often time) to a function of a complex variable. (complex frequency)

Name: Random Graphs (Math)
Description: Random set of vertices and edges
